metadata.dc:title: Domeier and Torsvik (2014) GPlates Reconstruction
metadata.dc:creator: Matthew Domeier
metadata.dc:subject: empty
metadata.dc:description: The Domeier and Torsvik reconstruction is a global, fully topological reconstruction of late Paleozoic plate tectonics. The files available within the web service are provided in the supplementary dataset to the original article. The rotation file is constructed to easily switch between a paleomagnetic reference frame (anchor plate = 1), or a mantle reference frame incorporating a correction for True Polar Wander (anchor plate = 0).
metadata.dc:source: Domeier, M. and Torsvik, T.H., 2014. Plate tectonics in the late Paleozoic. Geoscience Frontiers, v5, 303-350. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.gsf.2014.01.002
